before:
message = "Hello"
print(message)
after:
Alpha = "Lorem Ipsum"
print(Alpha)

description: Two variables and a concatenated print
before:
first = "Hello"
second = "World"
print(first + " " + second)
after:
Alpha = "Lorem Ipsum"
Bravo = "Dolor sit amet"
print(Alpha + "Consectetur adipiscing elit" + Bravo)

before:
x = 10  # this is a number
print(x)
after:
Alpha = 10
print(Alpha)

before:
def add(a, b):
    return a + b

result = add(2, 3)
print(result)
after:
def Function1(Alpha, Bravo):
    return Alpha + Bravo

Charlie = Function1(2, 3)
print(Charlie)

description: Reused variable name mapping in same snippet
before:
count = 1
count = count + 1
print(count)
after:
Alpha = 1
Alpha = Alpha + 1
print(Alpha)

before:
name = "Alice"
msg = f"Hello, {name}!"
print(msg)
after:
Alpha = "Lorem Ipsum"
Bravo = f"Dolor {Alpha} sit amet"
print(Bravo)

before:
i = 0
while i < 3:
    print("tick")
    i += 1
after:
Alpha = 0
while Alpha < 3:
    print("Lorem Ipsum")
    Alpha += 1

before:
user = {"name": "Alice", "role": "admin"}
print(user["name"])
after:
Alpha = {"Lorem Ipsum": "Dolor sit amet", "Consectetur adipiscing elit": "Sed do eiusmod"}
print(Alpha["Lorem Ipsum"])

before:
def log(*args, **kwargs):
    print("args", args)
    print("kwargs", kwargs)

log(1, 2, mode="fast")
after:
def Function1(*Alpha, **Bravo):
    print("Lorem Ipsum", Alpha)
    print("Dolor sit amet", Bravo)

Function1(1, 2, mode="Consectetur adipiscing elit")

before:
inc = lambda x: x + 1
print(inc(5))
after:
Alpha = lambda Bravo: Bravo + 1
print(Alpha(5))

before:
nums = [1, 2, 3]
squares = [n*n for n in nums]
print(squares)
after:
Alpha = [1, 2, 3]
Bravo = [Charlie*Charlie for Charlie in Alpha]
print(Bravo)

before:
nums = [1, 2, 3]
total = sum(n for n in nums)
print(total)
after:
Alpha = [1, 2, 3]
Bravo = sum(Charlie for Charlie in Alpha)
print(Bravo)

before:
a, b = 1, 2
b, a = a, b
print(a, b)
after:
Alpha, Bravo = 1, 2
Bravo, Alpha = Alpha, Bravo
print(Alpha, Bravo)

description: File read using context manager (variables anonymised, strings anonymised)
before:
path = "data.txt"
with open(path, "r") as f:
    content = f.read()
print(content)
after:
Alpha = "Lorem Ipsum"
with open(Alpha, "Dolor sit amet") as Bravo:
    Charlie = Bravo.read()
print(Charlie)

description: Simple module-style constants (variables anonymised, string anonymised)
before:
API_URL = "https://example.com"
TIMEOUT = 5
print(API_URL, TIMEOUT)
after:
Alpha = "Lorem Ipsum"
Bravo = 5
print(Alpha, Bravo)

description: Docstring removal (treated as comment) + regular comment removal
before:
"""Module docstring"""

def compute(x):
    """Compute something"""
    # double it
    return x * 2

print(compute(3))

value = "start"
match value:
    case "start":
        print("go")
    case _:
        print("stop")
after:
Alpha = "Lorem Ipsum"
match Alpha:
    case "Dolor sit amet":
        print("Consectetur adipiscing elit")
    case _:
        print("Sed do eiusmod")

before:
import asyncio

async def main():
    msg = "running"
    print(msg)

asyncio.run(main())
after:
import asyncio

async def Function1():
    Alpha = "Lorem Ipsum"
    print(Alpha)

asyncio.run(Function1())

description: Class composition + method calls + multiple strings
More complex f-string with multiple expressions
before:
first = "Ada"
last = "Lovelace"
full = f"{first} {last}"
print(f"User: {full}")
after:
Alpha = "Lorem Ipsum"
Bravo = "Dolor sit amet"
Charlie = f"{Alpha} {Bravo}"
print(f"Consectetur adipiscing elit {Charlie}")
